alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Nicollet; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:48AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Sibley, northwestern Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 648 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lafayette, or 10 miles northeast of New Ulm, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gaylord around 700 AM CDT. This includes U.S. Highway 14 near mile marker 105, and between mile markers 107 and 122. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central and central Minnesota.
